p: During previous influenza A(H3N2) epidemics in 2014/15, 2016/17 and 2017/18, the percentage of unvaccinated influenza A(H3N2) cases by single year of age was evenly distributed across the age range. In these three seasons, the median age of influenza A(H3N2) cases was consistently at least 30 years (33, 30 and 36.5 years, respectively) and did not differ significantly from controls (30, 31 and 34 years, respectively) [ 2]. Vaccinated cases were older, with median age consistently more than 50 years (53, 54 and 57 years, respectively), which was also not significantly different from controls (52, 55 and 52 years, respectively) ( Supplementary Figure S11).
